algorithm_technique: String comparison and character difference tracking
problem_summary_simple: Check if two strings can become equal by swapping exactly two characters in one string.
problem_summary_technical: Compares strings character by character, identifying differences. Returns true if exactly two differences exist and are swappable, or if there are duplicate characters and no differences.
time_complexity: O(N) where N is the length of the strings
space_complexity: O(1) (or O(alphabet size) if considering the set for duplicates)
key_insights: If strings have different lengths, they can never be buddy strings.
If strings are identical, a swap is only valid if there are duplicate characters in the string.
If strings differ, there must be exactly two differing characters, and they must be swappable to match.
